forecast.name: Veterans Day
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain before 4pm, then a slight chance of drizzle. Mostly sunny. High near 60, with temperatures falling to around 56 in the afternoon. West wind around 17 mph, with gusts as high as 25 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.shortForecast: Slight Chance Drizzle then Mostly Clear
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of drizzle before 10pm. Mostly clear, with a low around 50. West northwest wind 6 to 14 mph, with gusts as high as 22 mph. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
The morning over Downtown San Francisco carries the unmistakable hush of rain-soaked air, with clouds hanging low, casting a muted pallor upon the city. As the last vestiges of drizzle attempt to linger before giving way to brighter patches, there’s a promise of a clearer afternoon on this Veterans Day. Yet, as the wind sweeps in from the west, it nudges the leaves with a brisk, playful bite, a reminder that the warmth of sunny days is still an elusive dance in this coastal town. 

While a tentative sun may peek through in the latter part of the day, the air remains cool and crisp, urging layers for warmth—a light jacket would serve well, perhaps knit gloves for those who can’t resist a stroll. The seas shimmer with a restless energy, touched by the ghost of a marine layer that flees as the sun’s rays begin to break through. For those inclined to venture outdoors, a gentle walk through the park or a visit to one of the local cafés offers refuge from the chill—perfect for sipping something warm while watching the world adjust to the transforming skies.
